title: HardhatError: HH5: HardhatContext is not created.
body:
### Version of Hardhat

2.13.1

### What happened?

Installed [hardhat-test-utils ](https://www.npmjs.com/package/hardhat-test-utils#api), and then `import ethers as eth from hardhat` in typescript became unreadable to the compiler. I was not using the plugin, so I simply removed the import, but upon running my scripts, hardhat threw an error and asked me to make a bug report, and my app will not run.

### Minimal reproduction steps

-Write hardhat tests in typescript
-Install hardhat and hardhat-test-utils
-Run scripts

Other actions performed:
Hardhat forking 
Launched hardhat node (successfully)
Deployed contract to localhost (successfully)


Update: I uninstalled hardhat-test-utils and re-installed hardhat-ethers and my scripts now work again. I am only reporting this as I was directed to do so by hardhat.


### Search terms

_No response_

My guess is that you imported the plugin in a script/test that then was executed directly (i.e., not with `hh run` or `hh test`). But hard to know without a complete reproduction.

Tentatively closing, but will re-open if there's a [MRE](https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example) demonstrating that there's a problem in Hardhat.
